body: Do you use synchronize option in connection?  Please check https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/2034

@nbaua You should create index with unique flag
Not sure, in columns unique flag for mongodb has no effect
Do not understand. it is "Unique index" https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/core/index-unique/.
Probably we add this in future to  mongodb schema building

@vlapo, 
I'll check on @Index({ unique: true}) later some time. Thanks for your time.

issue.title: MongoError: Index

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
**Issue type:**

[ ] question
[x] bug report
[ ] feature request
[ ] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[x] `mongodb`
[ ] `mssql`
[ ] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[ ] `postgres`
[ ] `cockroachdb`
[ ] `sqlite`
[ ] `sqljs`
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[x] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[x] `0.2.17` (or put your version here)

**MongoDB version: 4.0.3_1**

**Steps to reproduce or a small repository showing the problem:**

I use TypeORM together with NestJS (6.3.1) and MongoDB (4.0.3). Since I updated to the latest version of TypeORM (0.2.18), the server can't be started anymore.

I get the following error message with an existing database:

```
MongoError: Index with name: IDX_e12875dfb3b1d92d7d7c5377e2 already exists with different options
```

As soon as I delete the database and try to restart the server, I get the following error message:

```
MongoError: Index keys cannot be empty.
```

In version 0.2.16 of TypeORM everything still works. As soon as I use 0.2.17 or 0.2.18 the errors occur.

I can avoid the error by commenting out the block from line 51 to 57 in `src/schema-builder/MongoSchemaBuilder.ts`:

```
 metadata.uniques.forEach(unique => {
                const options = <MongodbIndexOptions>{
                    name: unique.name,
                    unique: true,
                };
                promises.push(queryRunner.createCollectionIndex(metadata.tableName, unique.columnNamesWithOrderingMap, options));
});
```

The block was added in 0.2.17 to fix #3624, but now leads to the described errors.
